bioghist.p: William Wister Haines (1908-1989) was an American author, screenwriter, and playwright. Haines graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 1931 with a degree in engineering. His first novel, Slim, was published in 1934 and was made into a movie in 1937. In World War II, Haines served with the US Army Air Force in London. Over the course of his writing career, Haines published many novels, plays, and screenplays, including Command Decision, The Target, The Image, and Ultra.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts and published editions of plays, novels, stories, essays, articles, screenplays, and poems by William Wister Haines. Manuscripts of novels include The Target, The Image, Slim, Winter War, Standard of Living, and End of the Rainbow. The collection also includes a number of short stories that were never published.
